Course Description: THIS COURSE IS A STUDY OF ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES AS THEY APPLY TO GOVERNMENTAL ORGANIZATIONS AND NOT-FOR-PROFIT ENTITIES.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
1.APPLY CONCEPTS AND APPLICATIONS TO GOVERNMENT ORGANIZATIONS AND NONPROFIT ENTITIES. 
2.JOURNALIZE ACCOUNTING ENTRIES FOR GOVERNMENTAL ORGANIZATIONS. 
3.PREPARE PROPER REPORTS ON GOVERNMENTAL ENTITIES. 
4.IDENTIFY AND EVALUATE THE ELEMENTS OF THE COMPREHENSIVE ANNUAL FINANCIAL REPORT.
5.EXAMINE THE PRONOUNCEMENTS SET FORTH BY THE GOVERNMENTAL ACCOUNTING STANDARDS BOARD.
6.DEMONSTRATE UNDERSTANDING OF A GOVERNMENTAL ORGANIZATIONS ACCOUNTING SYSTEM BY PREPARING A COMPREHENSIVE PROBLEM.
7.INTERPRET AND APPLY ACCOUNTING TECHNIQUES AND METHODS USED FOR THE VARIOUS FUNDS WITHIN GOVERNMENTAL UNITS AND NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS.
8.COMPARE AND CONTRAST BUDGETING AND REPORTING PROCEDURES USED BY FOR-PROFIT, GOVERNMENTAL, AND NOT-FOR-PROFIT ENTITIES.
9.INTERPRET AND APPLY LEGAL AND ETHICAL REPORTING PROCEDURES AS REQUIRED BY GOVERNING BODIES.
